conclusion: Analyze the process from state A to state B using thermodynamics and ideal gas law.
Line segment AB is parallel to the V-axis, indicating constant temperature at T_A = T_0.
The process from state A to state B is isothermal.
The ideal gas law is PV = nRT.
For constant temperature, P_A V_A = P_B V_B.
Work done by gas in isothermal process is W = nRT ln(V_B/V_A).
Given work done is 10 J, 10 = nRT_0 ln(V_B/V_A).
For isothermal process, change in internal energy (ΔU) is zero.
From first law of thermodynamics, ΔU = Q - W, so Q = W.
The heat absorbed by the gas during the process from state A to state B is 10 J.
